content.text:
II'll explore the codebase to understand the current structure and context. Let me start by examining what files exist and get familiar with the project layout.

```bash
# First, let me see what directories and files exist in the root
ls -la
```

```bash
# Let me also check the git history to understand recent changes
git log --oneline -10
```

```bash
# Check if there are any important configuration files
find . -name "*.json" -o -name "*.yml" -o -name "*.yaml" -o -name "*.toml" -o -name "*.py" -o -name "*.js" -o -name "*.ts" | head -20
```

```bash
# Let me look for any Python files which might be the main implementation
find . -name "*.py" | head -20
```

Based on the git history I can see this is a project called "speckit" with recent work on ROS2 nervous system implementation. There's been work on specs, plans, and tasks related to a "ros2-nervous-system" feature. Let me explore further to understand the codebase better.
